content.text: three core templates for the Services section
these will form the structural base for all future service pages.
Final content and copy will be added after Shaun reviews and approves the layout, structure, and flow.
Core Web Vitals and development constraints
to ensure all 150+ upcoming service pages can be created efficiently.
Layouts are intentionally simple, lightweight, and repeatable  optimized for readability, speed, and modular use across different service categories.
The tone and visual rhythm follow VEs System 1 clarity principles: minimal, fast-loading, and cleanly tiered.
Once approved, this structure will serve as the
for all future Services and sub-service pages.
, where are we on this rework?
Hi ma'am, we are currently working on about us pages will rework on services pages after that.

content.text: Weve converted the CSR page into the LayerOne design system and updated some UI elements. Please review the page and share your feedback.
Also, in the last section, theres a quote attributed to Shauncould you confirm if this is an original quote from Shaun or not?

Shaun had wanted 2 distinct pages - Giving Back to the Community and Corporate Philanthropy, which I had done. I am not sure who decided to merge both pages without first checking with me. He had shared a feedback video for the pages sometime last year where he made his views very clear on what needed to come on both pages.
Pls share the instructions you received to have both pages merged so that the same can be shared with Shaun should he question the deviation.
maam you are right, but recently Shaun Sir had sent an email to club all Charity activities on the CSR page, hence we have updated it. Please let us know if that works.
maam, could you please look at the page and share your feedback:
feedback added. Found the doc where I had scribbled Shauns notes while we had the call, or maybe I noted it from the video call, cant recall exactly.

All the comments you mentioned in Figma have been resolved. Could you please check once? Just one confusion  you had asked to add the Covid section, which has now been added, but currently the page has two Covid sections. Should we keep both, or should I remove the earlier one?

content.text: Podcast page design, this page will go under Resources section on website and it has been designed by Mohit:
Develop Responsive HTML Layout from Figma Design

Build the layout from scratch using the provided Figma design as reference. Ensure pixel-level accuracy in spacing, visual hierarchy, and typography across desktop (eg: 1440px), tablet (eg: 768px), and mobile (eg: 375px) breakpoints. Apply layout grids, constraints, and reusable components for consistency. Include interactive states (hover, focus) where applicable.
Layout is built from scratch in Figma, matching the provided reference with pixel-level accuracy.
Typography, spacing, and visual hierarchy align precisely with the design guide.
Responsive versions are created for desktop (1440px), tablet (768px), and mobile (375px) breakpoints.
Components, auto-layout, and constraints are used to ensure consistency and scalability.

HTML Development, Make responsive for all devices, Js functionality modal popup
We have add a new functionality that allows users to
play videos from a specific timestamp
directly from a clickable timeframe link or button. This improves usability and helps viewers jump straight to the exact section of a video without manually searching.
Each popup button can be assigned a
When clicked, the correct video is loaded inside the popup modal and starts playing auto and start playing video from timeframe(timestamp).

fields.summary: Make Live: Case Study Category Page (Layer One)

content.text: Design of Case Study page as per Layer One:
This task got delayed due to several issues,

This page was delayed due to recent design updates. Current template is working fine in the staging environment, but we're encountering a JavaScript conflict on the live site. The issue is related to the marketing form script, which is affecting both the page load and filter functionality. Im working on resolving this and will push it live shortly.

content.text: We are creating a unified, modular master template that will be used to redesign and standardize over 150 service pages across VEs website. The goal is to replace outdated layouts with a scalable structure consisting of 2025 flexible content sections that can be turned on/off based on the category (e.g., Development, Design, DM, Legal, VA, etc.).

The template will include universal sections (Hero, Benefits, FAQs, CTA), as well as category-specific modules like case studies, portfolios, compliance blocks, and AI-powered tools. Supporting UX/SEO elements such as long-form content, schema, internal linking blocks, and dynamic infographics are also part of the plan.
Once the section documentation is finalized, it will be reviewed with design and content stakeholders (Sandip, Mohit, etc.) before implementation.

resolution.description: Work has been completed on this work item.
resolution.name: Done

content.text: with the intent to make it more than just a media gallery  this is now a strategic, proof-first destination that showcases how VE truly works.
uses a scroll-block feature (to be implemented in dev) that ensures users experience our strongest videos before reaching the rest of the page.
Followed by a tabbed section with 4 key categories:
Life @ VE, Podcast, VE Offices, Testimonials
each showing a distinct, real-world side of VE.
, meaning we can add more tabs/categories easily as our video library expands.
CTA at the bottom guides warm viewers toward a no-pressure next step  staying true to our mid-funnel tone.
throughout  layout, spacing, font rhythm  and kept the entire page clean, evaluator-friendly, and scalable.
